comment: Important to be in class, power points are a lot of pictures with explanations and stories from his personal experiences. You can tell how passionate he is about what he teaches which makes it so much more interesting.

Each time I take a class with Dr. Powis, I grow to enjoy him and his style of teaching more and more. He has consistently been my favorite professor in the department and I highly recommend that you take any and every class he offers.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Absolutely LOVED this man! I am taking him again in the spring, he is very passionate about his work and his class. He grades well and quickly, being one of the professors I actually enjoy going to class for.

Dr.Powis is incredible at his job. He gives very clear feedback and guild lines for all assignments. His lectures can be a little dry and he does talk about his work in belize like every day but he's a nice guy. The only thing is making sure you remember the examples of sites he talks about in class for the tests, also attendance is key.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: He provides amble material and opportunities to learn. Many hands on projects which really makes you understand the material. Plenty of informative powerpoints and handouts. He really is happy to be a professor and teach students which means a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Hes great at explaining everything, so reading the book isnt entirely necessary. Hes phenomenal at his field school and super funny but grades pretty harshly on the term paper. Watch out for that.

Dr Powis is passionate about what he does and he inspires that same passion in everybody who takes his classes. He is always there for his students and is happy to give advice about life as well as class.

Great teacher, great lecturer. He assigns 3 tests and one research paper and that's it. The majority of the test questions come from the notes from his lectures so you need to go to class. He is very helpful, answers emails quickly, and is a fair grader. I've taken him a couple times already and will take him again if possible.
Attendance is mandatory. Class is presentations by students. Tests are written, but very easy by reading the articles. I received an A. Piece of cake! Totally recommend

Dr. Powis is a fantastic teacher. It's important to go to class, as that is what the tests are going to be over. He keeps it interesting, and plus, you get to actually go out and do archaeological research.

Mr. Powis has an interesting class. It's based on presentations from students, and he adds his two cents to each. Grades come from 3 tests, the presentation,and a 2 page paper. Tests are written but aren't difficult.Be open minded because you're bound to disagree with one of the articles. Ask him about jackalopes sometime.

Wonderful professor, you'll have a difficult time not enjoying this course. He is a very well rounded individual in the field of archeology and you can tell how much he enjoys talking about all things anthropology. I had him fall semester as a sophomore at 9:30 on Mondays and Wednesdays and it was great, he makes he class discussions very cool!

I had Dr.Powis for Archaeology Field School in Belize, and while I'm sure living with the man for a month is different than seeing him a few times a week i can say he is amazing and passionate about anything and everything archaeology and anthropology and i would highly recommend taking any and all classes he offers. he is fair and very helpful.

He makes anthropology so interesting. His tests consist of true/false, matching, and short answer. They're pretty easy if you study. There is also a poster project. Don't buy the book, all you need is from his lectures. Bring a laptop though because he goes through the slides quickly. Very helpful if you have any concerns or questions.

Dr. Powis is the best professor I have ever had. I had him for the Archaeology Field School and other classes. He is very understanding, nice, and he teaches well. He also has a good sense of humor. The field school was fun, but a lot of hard work digging in the heat.
Seriously, if you want to learn and love what you do, take this class!  Dr. Powis is an all-around professor who knows how to inspire and teach.
Dr. Powis is awesome! Extremely knowledgeable, has a sense of humor, and keeps the class interesting. Love learning from him.

Great professor! Extremely knowledgeable. Class got to participate in an archaeological dig, which was awesome. One paper, approx. 4 pages - topic of your choice (relating to valuable archaeological discoveries), with Powis' approval.

As Powis has been to the Maya area countless times for study, he has a lot of personal experience, photos, and artifacts to share as a supplement to this course. 3 tests and 1 paper (10-12 pages, topic of your choice, approved by Powis). Take good notes!!
He was a great professor. Really inspired me to learn more of the subject and I loved our in class discussions. Really brought new perspectives into everyone's minds.

Covers material with the right amount of depth. You could probably get by without the corresponding reading, but definitely recommended. Classes are mostly lectures but move quickly. Four one-to-two page reaction papers based on articles on reserve. Exams are not cumulative. Poster project instead of a paper.
SOOO NICE. EASY A. interesting material; debate presentations and lecture every class. but it's fun. take him!!! he's soo cool, no papers to write, fairly easy tests and extra credit opp
great teacher
Easy class
Very, very good teacher. There are daily class discussions about the issue of the day. I found the class entertaining and informative.
Great Teacher!
The class itself was disappointing and had little to do with what I was lead to believe in the beginning but Dr. Powis was happy to work with comprehension and gave very clear notes.

This was an elective for me and when I signed up for it I had absolutely NO interest, Dr. Powis made me interested, I loved going to class and for me that is rare! Go to class and take notes, the test are easy! You have to go to an archaelogical site two Saturdays,but you have no class for three and it is 45% of your grade.

Wonder professor. Very engaging lecturer. Tests are almost strait from notes - take good notes and study them and you will do wonderful on the tests, which are T/F, matching, short answer, and an essay. Very helpful.

Unlike the previous post, I believe Dr. Powis is an excellent professor. He is a subject matter expert and a genuine Archaeologist. I cannot speak for how he teaches the introductory courses, but in an upper level course he is top notch. Highly recommended!!
Professor wasn't clear in lectures. I had to go to the book to take my own notes in order to understand class material. He was very dry and seemed like he didn't want to be there.
